definition: lit. to invite the wind/fig. conspicuous and inviting criticism
to recruit/to provoke/to beckon/to incur/to infect/contagious/a move (chess)/a maneuver/device/trick/to confess
lit. a tall tree attracts the wind (idiom)/fig. a famous or rich person attracts criticism
to stir up trouble (idiom)/to sow discord
see 招風惹草|招风惹草[zhao1 feng1 re3 cao3]
see 招風惹草|招风惹草[zhao1 feng1 re3 cao3]

sentences.english: Perot had big jug ears, which were accentuated by his short crew cut.
sentences.chinese: 佩羅長着招風大耳，剪得很短的平頭使耳朵更加突出。

sentences.english: Simply because you wind big tree?
sentences.chinese: 僅僅是因爲樹大招風嗎？

sentences.english: Windcatchers are sometimes used in conjunction with underground water canals to cool buildings.
sentences.chinese: 招風斗有時和地下水管道聯合起來使用以冷卻建築物。

sentences.english: Envy assails the noblest, the winds howl around the highest peak.
sentences.chinese: 位高遭人妒，峯高招風怒。
